required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Efficacy of Lenvatinib Combined With Denosumab in the Treatment of Patients With Predominant Bone Metastatic Radioiodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinomas
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicentre Phase II Study of the Efficacy of Lenvatinib Combined With Denosumab in the Treatment of Patients With Predominant Bone Metastatic Radioiodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinomas (LENVOS)

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the combination of lenvatinib with denosumab in bone-predominant metastatic Radioiodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinomas. All patients will receive this combination of treatments.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients are usually considered for directed therapy (radiotherapy and/or surgery and/or thermo-ablation) in case of symptomatic lesions or at high risk of local complications. They also usually receive systemic bone-directed agents (bisphosphonate or denosumab), despite sparse available data in the context of differentiated thyroid carcinomas (DTC). As bone-directed agents have no antitumor activity, patients may require additional treatments. To date, only sorafenib and lenvatinib have been approved in the treatment of advanced Radioiodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinomas (RR-DTC).
Lenvatinib demonstrated efficacy in RR-DTC compared to placebo. While other kinase inhibitors appeared to be less effective in controlling bone metastatic disease compared to other soft tissue sites, lenvatinib showed, in a small number of patients, significant decrease in bone tumors size.
Even if both study drugs are indicated in the treatment of patients suffering from RR-DTC with bone metastases, it is of essential importance to confirm that lenvatinib can provide clinical benefit and antitumor activity when combined with denosumab in this population.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients with predominant bone metastases from Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma (RR-DTC)

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the efficacy of lenvatinib associated with denosumab in the treatment of patients with predominant bone metastases from Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
primary_outcome.description: The 24-month Skeletal-Related Event-Free (24M-SREF) rate will be defined as the proportion of patients without occurrence of new bone metastatic lesions at 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the efficacy of lenvatinib associated with denosumab in the treatment of patients with predominant bone metastases from Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
primary_outcome.description: The 24-month Skeletal-Related Event-Free (24M-SREF) rate will be defined as the proportion of patients without pathological bone fracture (either vertebral or non-vertebral) at 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the efficacy of lenvatinib associated with denosumab in the treatment of patients with predominant bone metastases from Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
primary_outcome.description: The 24-month Skeletal-Related Event-Free (24M-SREF) rate will be defined as the proportion of patients without spinal cord compression at 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the efficacy of lenvatinib associated with denosumab in the treatment of patients with predominant bone metastases from Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
primary_outcome.description: The 24-month Skeletal-Related Event-Free (24M-SREF) rate will be defined as the proportion of patients without bone-related orthopedic surgical intervention at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the progression free survival
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival will be defined as the time from the date of inclusion to the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the objective response rate
secondary_outcome.description: Objective Response Rate will be defined as the proportion of patients with a best overall response of Complete Response or Partial Response during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the time to the first local procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Time to the first local procedure will be defined as the time from the date of inclusion to the date of any local procedure (external beam radiation therapy, thermoablation, cementoplasty…) aiming at relieving bone-related symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the time to treatment failure
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Treatment Failure will be measured from the time of inclusion until discontinuation of treatment for any reason other than 'protocol deviation' or 'administrative problems', including SRE, clinical deterioration, treatment toxicity, and death.
Analgesic consumption will be assessed and presented in morphine equivalent by 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the Quality of life using European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Using the EORTC QLQ-C30 (Quality of Life Questionnaire) - Scale range: 1 (better outcome) to 4 (worse outcome) for 28 variables and from 1 (better outcome) to 7 (worse outcome) for 2 variables

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the Quality of life using European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Using the EORTC QLQ-BM22 (Bone Metastasis module) - Scale range 1 (better outcome) to 4 (worse outcome) for 22 items.
Tolerance profile will be described through the incidence and severity of drug-related adverse events (AE), AESI, SAE and deaths according to the last version of the NCI-CTC AE classification

other_outcome.measure: Detremination of predictive biomarker of tumor response
other_outcome.description: Serum levels of Carboxy-terminal collagen crosslinks

other_outcome.measure: Detremination of predictive biomarker of tumor response
Detremination of predictive biomarker of tumor response
other_outcome.description: Serum levels of bone alkaline phosphatases

other_outcome.measure: Detremination of predictive biomarker of tumor response
Detremination of predictive biomarker of tumor response
other_outcome.description: Serum levels of soluble receptor activator of nuclear factor-kB ligand

other_outcome.measure: Detremination of predictive factors of tumor response
other_outcome.description: Levels of tumor perfusion (ml/minute) associated with anti-tumor efficacy

arm_group.description: Lenvatinib and Denosumab will be used in the indication of their respective SmPCs. Study treatments will be divided in fictitious cycles of 28 days. Lenvatinib and Denosumab will be administered as per investigator's decision, based on the data from their SmPC, at starting doses of 24mg once daily and 120mg once every 4 weeks, respectively. Dose modification guidelines of their respective SmPCs will apply. Lenvatinib should be started the day after the inclusion. It will be taken every day at the same time, preferentially in the morning. As in routine practice, all patients will be supplemented with daily doses of at least 500mg Calcium and 400IU Vitamin D, unless hypercalcemia is present. Patients will be encouraged to maintain good oral hygiene during treatment with Denosumab. Study drugs will be continued until a treatment discontinuation criterion is met.

intervention.description: Lenvatinib and Denosumab will be used in the indication of their respective SmPCs. Study treatments will be divided in fictitious cycles of 28 days. Lenvatinib and Denosumab will be administered as per investigator's decision, based on the data from their SmPC, at starting doses of 24mg once daily and 120mg once every 4 weeks, respectively. Dose modification guidelines of their respective SmPCs will apply. Lenvatinib should be started the day after the inclusion. It will be taken every day at the same time, preferentially in the morning. As in routine practice, all patients will be supplemented with daily doses of at least 500mg Calcium and 400IU Vitamin D, unless hypercalcemia is present. Patients will be encouraged to maintain good oral hygiene during treatment with Denosumab. Study drugs will be continued until a treatment discontinuation criterion is met
